website_summaries.verdict: The Sony STR-DN850 has it all: bountiful Wi-Fi networking features, the brawn to provide maximum home theater fun, and the refinement to bring a string quartet recording to life.
pros: The Sony STR-DN850 receiver offers a very good selection of features for the price, including built-in Wi-Fi, AirPlay, Spotify, and Bluetooth
It delivers excellent sound quality for both surround sound and music
Sony's user interface and remote control are attractive and easy to use
cons: Lacks the extended connectivity of the DN1050 including component inputs, MHL HDMI and Zone 2 amplification

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! Sony stopped support for SongPal and forced an "upgrade" to Music Center for the STR-DN850 receiver. You will not be able to control it from your phone or cast anything to it anymore, rendering as useful as a receiver from the 80's. I bought it as a media room receiver and a year later I can't control it from the media room. Changing the volume, source, etc. is no longer available. From Sony: With the update to ver.5.2, Music Center will no longer be compatible with STR-DN850/STR-DN1050/ICF-CS20BT/XDR-DS21BT. Some features may not be supported by certain devices.
customer_reviews.author: John Martin

customer_reviews.title: Died after a year
customer_reviews.text: Pros - it can stream via bluetooth or connect to a device on your home network Cons - on screen setup is required Biggest problem with it is that mine stopped working just shy of a year. The receiver stopped powering on. Nothing I tried solved the problem. For comparison, in 2011 I purchased the Sony STR-DH810 for a different room and it is still going strong. So is my Harmon Kardon AVR-325 receiver which is over a decade old. Have not yet decided if I'll try to get warranty service, or just cut my losses and move on.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of HDMI output.
customer_reviews.text: HDMI output stop working on the second day after I received it, seem as if this issue is common with most people that purchase this product after reading the reviews, I requesting a replacement for the same model because I love all the feature for the price...hopefully the replacement works but if it have the same issue I would not purchase this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Paraboo

customer_reviews.title: worked great for maybe 5 months
customer_reviews.text: worked great for maybe 5 months, then the protector would go off. Suddenly shut down everything... turn it on and back off to bypass it and watch TV Till 3 months later, when even having the TV too loud kicks off the protector Then you get used to having it a low volumes and suddenly it kicks off the protector any time the volume changes in a TV show or movie... Then one day it kicks off and doesn't kick back on. I really had higher expectations for sony... the only reason I waited this long was so the extended warranty would kick in and I'd get a complete replacement rather than have to deal with OEM warranty.
customer_reviews.author: TheElderGodFather

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Receiver!
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this unit, and absolutely love it!!! I read many reviews of the STR-DN1050 and the STR-DN850. Received a great price, and chose the STR_DN850 for a variety reasons. 1. The small difference in wattage did not matter, 2. I had no need for 2nd zone processing, 3. I've only a need for 2 HDMI connections (Blu-Ray and MAC), 4. The WiFi works although it already existed in my Blu-Ray player, and 5. I was hoping for outstanding audio performance - and I GOT IT!!! My initial impression of the unit is that it is OUTSTANDING!!! Excellent sound, easy setup, simple user interface, and most of all, IT WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.author: SB_Tops

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed to see issues like this on Day 1 and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this receiver on a Black Friday sale in 2014, and am just now installing it. Unfortunately it seems I'm victim to a very commonly reported problem of the HDMI output failing. The video and audio go in and out every couple minutes and sometimes just cut off completely. At that point, if I unplug and reconnect the HDMI cable, it starts working again for a short while but then continues to go in and out sporadically. I have tried several HDMI cables, all name brands including Monster Cable. Very disappointed to see issues like this on Day 1 and will look into returning the unit to Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Kohn

customer_reviews.title: Good product at the core, but some faulty features
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good product however it's built in wifi broke on mine within 45 days of buying it. Sony refused to fix it saying I should simply hardwire it instead (which isn't possible based on my home setup). The AirPlay function was faulty from the start, occasionally connecting and sometimes not at all. When it did connect it would take 10 to 15 minutes before it actually worked and would play. Besides the hardware issues, the sound quality and performance of the receiver itself is fantastic. The ability to properly set itself up with the included microphone made setup easy and fast and can be run multiple times if your setup ever changes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bell

customer_reviews.title: like DVD player come in and out
customer_reviews.text: All HDMI inputs, other than cable TV, like DVD player come in and out. Constant resetting and sometimes turning receiver on and off help but there has been no permanent fix. Sony customer support is of no help as all they can suggest is "resetting", which seems to help for a time or two but then reception problems return. Additionally, all the other input devices work well with the receiver bypassed and, therefore, the problem is definitely with the receiver. I'm in process of returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Patrizi

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase Sony
customer_reviews.text: I hate this thing! Sony has been my “go to” brand but no longer. This “thing” is too damn complicated to operate! The “instructions” are impossible! I wanted 7.1 sound – it is all I asked – but no luck with Sony. Look to another brand – not Sony
customer_reviews.author: Apple

customer_reviews.title: Hdmi failed after 2 years!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the stereo when I recieved it. Easy to hookup and nice to have all the hdmi inputs and 1 output to the TV. Fast forward 2 years and the radio has no sound, hdmi inputs and output don't work. Only thing that works now is the optical from the TV. Last Sony I owned lasted 16 years.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Blume

customer_reviews.title: Receiver that can’t catch a cold
customer_reviews.text: Like all the other negative reviews, the video simply failed. Can’t fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Spoons

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition for my small home living room
customer_reviews.text: This receiver is great! Once I figured out all the bells and whistles, it has surpassed the 2 year old Yamaha that it replaced (Yamaha died just 4 months out of warranty). Originally I also tried the 1050 because I wanted to feed another HDMI cable to my kitchen, but with the 1050 you need to leave a portion of it on to pass along signal, that drew about the same wattage as keeping the 1050 on. So I opted for the less expensive 850, and used a $ 15.00 HDMI splitter that draws hardly any electricity. I believe the 1050 was drawing something like 40 watts, compared to the splitter 1 watt or so.
customer_reviews.author: L. T.

customer_reviews.title: i know what i like when i hear it
customer_reviews.text: While i am no audiophile, i know what i like when i hear it, and i really like the Sony STRDN850's sound and ease of setup. I purchased this unit after my Marantz NR 1501 died. The sound is all we need- power is more than adequate. Plenty of inputs for my Blu Ray, Sonos, Sat Receiver, and TV (no game devices here, but have inputs for that also). The on-screen menus were intuitive and gave the user just what they need. Still working out the remote situation with my Harmony, so i cannot speak to the connectivity there. But, yeah, we really like it.
customer_reviews.author: jjincencal

customer_reviews.title: Would be 5-Stars...
customer_reviews.text: This receiver has so much potential...when it works. It has great sound, and would be good value for the money. With that said, as the months (year) has gone on, I've noticed a series of problems that just keep getting worse and worse. From the HDMI more or less failing, and when it does work, I have to jump through remote hoops to get it to show a picture. To the overheating issues. To the unsolicited input selection swapping. All those things just make this a significantly poor product.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Fenolio

customer_reviews.title: Automagic sound!
customer_reviews.text: This Sony is replacing an earlier model (which has now found a home in the den). Because of my positive experience with its predecessor, and Sony in general, I had no qualms about buying it. It has all the connectors I need for surround sound and multiple source inputs, and it includes a handy microphone that will automagically set up the speakers for best listening, from one point in the room. The wife and I have joined recliners, so I just held the microphone head-level between our chairs and let Sony do the rest. I don't qualify as an audiophile, but it sure sounds great to me!
customer_reviews.author: tomtees

customer_reviews.title: I think I'm just about done with Sony brand!
customer_reviews.text: Biggest POS I've ever bought! Died in less than 2 years and even when it did work, it was nearly impossible to get to work properly! All my electronics are Sony, but I have a feeling that I'm just about done with the brand! The Sony STR-DN770 that I have is nothing to write home about either! HDMI Pass-through is a nightmare! Works only about 50% of the time and dies the other 50%!
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: it was good value and upgrade from the older Sony unit that ...
customer_reviews.text: While this was the previous year's model, it was good value and upgrade from the older Sony unit that I replaced. It was interesting exercise implementing the new receiver with existing devices including Samsung Smart TV, Blue Ray Player, and Sony 400 CD player. I was not able to incorporate a Vizio Sound-bar 5.1 speaker system, which I purchased soon after purchasing the receiver. While the receiver was able to do 7.1 standard, I used my existing speakers for 5.1 surround sound. The sound was significant improvement over older receiver and enhanced viewing of the content with surround sound.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos from FL

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and features for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and features for the price. I use this in a relatively small living room but they are powering big bookshelf speakers and some satellites. The audio is crisp and clear across my mismatched speakers. I loved the fact that it supports all the various audio codecs including Dolby HD MA. I like the versatility of the bluetooth connectivity. I haven't used the wireless networking function yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Finally replaced my Sony Receiver I bought in 1999. The sound is excellent. Hooked to front and read Onkyo speakers, a Harman Kardon Sub as well as an Onkyo Sub. Also Harman Kardan Mid speakers. Due to placement of wires I have hooked up a wireless rear speaker kit. Overall, the sound is excellent. The hook-ups are self explanatory but a little cumbersome to hook the speaker wire into all the ports. Easy fix (that I am too cheap to do) is Banana Plugs. The onscreen menu is awesome. Much better than hitting buttons and waiting to find out what they actually did.
customer_reviews.author: HoHo

customer_reviews.title: You won't be Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: The STR-DN850 performs flawlessly. Set up has already been described by others and I can say it worked just that simply for me. I have delved into some of the features and have a complaint! After connecting the system to my WiFi I was able to see my Music Folders for streaming from my Server, but wasn't given the same access to my Movie Folders. I know this is a Tuner / Receiver, but times have changed and Music isn't the only function. In fact there are more connections on this device for HDMI than any other. Just a nudge Sony.
customer_reviews.author: W. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This NOOB loves this
customer_reviews.text: I love the connections, wireless, DNLA, Bluetooth, HDMI,..... I wish there was more inputs. If you have alot of devices like a cable box, roku, apple play, chrome, xbox, ps, ninetendo, computer, dvd, blu ray, future devices there will not be enough inputs. I was able to set it up and appreciated the auto-sound balancing program to set up my. 5.1 system. This my first AV receiver and I dont regret buying it. It should be future proof for next few years.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: I used this for a month and it developed a ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a month and it developed a "Protect" error message and stopped working. I followed Sony's on-line advice for diagnosing and possibly fixing a "protect error" and nothing worked. Sony tech support was closed for the 3 day Labor Day weekend but I called 1-800-222-sony on the following Tuesday and got put on hold for 30 minutes and they cut me off. The Sony web site is so opaque that they make it almost impossible to contact them or learn where to take this machine for help. Clearly not a manufacturer that is interested in assisting a customer after a purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Morris

customer_reviews.title: You must be kidding
customer_reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive purchasing the STRDN850, due to some of the reviews. I am now on a fixed income and can not afford to waste my money on things that do not work...I didn't. Everything works great. Pairing of our devices were ridiculously simple...thank goodness. I had to start laughing when I went to my Dell computer and was checking on my iTunes playlist. An extra button was there in the toolbar so I clicked on it. My playlist started playing on the stereo. In the other room and the sound was fantastic. Everything sounds great and I no regrets at all.
customer_reviews.author: JJY

customer_reviews.title: Love this Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Love this Receiver, I have this paired With the Andrew Jones Pioneer speakers. Towers, Center, front highs, surrounds and sub. This is great if you are into good sound. All the options work well and it comes with the mic to calibrate. I used a program to tune it in and I have attached a picture of the last test I ran.
customer_reviews.author: Ripitywitt

customer_reviews.title: Nice receiver, but Sony app support discontinued
customer_reviews.text: Generally pleased with this receiver, it performs well and *had* most of the features I was looking for. However, I was extremely disappointed when Sony decided to pull the rug out from under me and stop supporting this particular model in their IOS app. I had been using it quite a bit. Seems like it wouldn't have required *too* much additional effort to put out one app for the latest-and-greatest, and another for so-called 'legacy' devices (mine was barely 12 months old at the time).
customer_reviews.author: R Gibb

customer_reviews.title: Okay as a replacement to match my existing speakers
customer_reviews.text: It has 2 learning curves. One small one to get you going that's pretty simple and the other is more in depth and not easy to understand unless you are a tech buff. The actual sound and power is fine but of course depends on the rest of your setup. After my previous one blew a couple of channels I went with this as it matched the room size and speakers and I'm used to Sony equipment. If you are starting from scratch I would buy locally and read a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Remote interface failed after 18 months.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality was very good, but the recievers remote control interface stopped working after 18 months so we have to manually turn it on and set the inputs as well as manually change volume now.
customer_reviews.author: Joz

customer_reviews.title: Got a good price tho
customer_reviews.text: Would be five stars but this receiver likes to randomly turn off and on again giving me no audio or video signal for about 5 seconds at a time. This happens about once ever 2 hours if I had to estimate. Extremely frustrating when in the middle of a game or movie. Got a good price tho, and everything else works great. Love being able to pass through 4k content and my new pioneer speakers I got to to go with this sound phenomenal. Even my sennheiser headphones sound noticeably better when plugged into the front headphone output.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.

customer_reviews.title: Too bad, it seemed like such a nice piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased October 22, 2015, HDMI out failed March 9, 2016. This essentially makes the unit worthless for A/V control. Can't return to Amazon. Does anyone know what Sony is doing about this? This appears to be an ongoing problem. Amazon should not be selling this model based on what I've read in these reviews. Next time I'll pay closer attention to the reviews before I buy! Finally contacted Sony and guess what? They had a resolution for my problem. Easy fix. Just hold in the on off button for five seconds and firmware is cleared and reset to factory settings. After that HDMI out started passing through video and audio. Every thing is back to normal. Thank you Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Smiley Face

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this to replace a Denon S7500 that I never really liked (and a previous Denon)
customer_reviews.text: A short note: Purchased this to replace a Denon S7500 that I never really liked (and a previous Denon). Glad I returned to Sony. The 850 is so simple to set up compared to the Denon, and it's so much more musical. A world of difference. Highly recommend this over Denon (or even NAD). Say what you want about Sony's diminishing place in the audio/video market, they get it right.
customer_reviews.author: Atomic Dog

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even get to try the product. I got ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even get to try the product. I got two of these units (original order and a replacement,) both had the same issue. The transformer wasn't secured properly and by the time I received the unit, there was a lot of internal damage done. Fragments of silicon were rattling around, the housing itself was bent from the inside. Giving one star because this happened on two separate units, it wasn't just one isolated incident.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like this unit
customer_reviews.text: I really like this unit. Plays my Apple TV (most recent version) very well with no glitches or issues at all. Also plays TV sound well. I'm not an audiophile, but it sounds nice, and with a powered sub-woofer, has plenty of oomph to it. I also like the way it connects to my iphone. Connecting with the wifi/airplay is the way to go; much much better sound quality than the bluetooth audio connection, which is just tolerable in terms of quality. The airplay does not always stay connected, but it was not hard to set up.
customer_reviews.author: John Huisman

customer_reviews.title: Great, but needs some improvements
customer_reviews.text: Love Sony HT recivers, but Sony really needs to work on the HDMI integration. At times the video will glitch a little. I currently have all inputs and the output using a high speed HDMI cable, and still have video problems. As for the sound, I enjoy the sound a lot. I have this Sony set up with Yamaha speakers (3.1 CH set up) and I enjoy the sound a lot. I love using the online features such as Spotify connect, and the remote app/s (songpal and tvSideview). I would highly suggest getting some banana plugs as wiring can be a pain if in tight spaces. Overall I am pleased with it, but it does need some work and improvements.
customer_reviews.author: tristandoo

customer_reviews.title: Really pleased with this receiver
customer_reviews.text: I really pleased with this receiver. It sounds good, it is not expensive, it has great and easy setup. After my previous Onkyo 509 AV receiver this Sony just a gift. Add to this terrible Onkyo service ( I hope, I will not will be forced to check Sony' service). The only thing - you obtain very basic manual. For slightly more complicated things you need to download full manual from the Sony site.
customer_reviews.author: sualexxx

customer_reviews.title: The warranty ended 10 days before the 2nd blowup and Sony admitted this was not good but refused to replace
customer_reviews.text: This product is a piece of junk!!! Purchased 7/25/2015. Sent back for repairs on 10/4/2015 for completely blown board. Called 8/7/2017 for exact same problem and they offered me a 25% on 2nd repairs. Piece of junk...and I am a long time Sony buyer, But I just purchased my last Sony product. Sony Customer service is rude and unresponsive. The warranty ended 10 days before the 2nd blowup and Sony admitted this was not good but refused to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Nespresso JUNK

customer_reviews.title: My favorite part of this receiver is the pure direct button ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a hog, so don't have it on a surge protector. My favorite part of this receiver is the pure direct button and the HD Digital Cinema. Once I got it hooked up right and the distances right on my speakers (which varies from speaker to speaker, some have better throw than others), this thing was cranking out HD sound with very little interference or noise. The pure direct mode really reduces noise a lot!
customer_reviews.author: John Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Just wow!
customer_reviews.text: This AV receiver is fantastic and works like a charm. My only real complaint is that the default setup is 3.2.1 with the "rear" being left and right side, NOT rear, so be mindful of the two screw down set as default should be wired as the assignable four connections. I am sure this unit will be my main for many years and with 4K upscaling it will run the gauntlet for some time!
customer_reviews.author: Cipher 79

customer_reviews.title: Had the device for about 2 months and was playing ...
customer_reviews.text: Had the device for about 2 months and was playing the thing and it shut down and never turned on again. I had to send it to a Sony repair dealer and during delivery it got broken by United parcel services . United parcel services stated that it got broken because it was not packaged properly and would not pay for the repair. I had to pay 205 dollars to have the thing fixed. If it was not faulty from the beginning I would not have had this headache. I will never buy Sony products again!
customer_reviews.author: Clark F.

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Sony receiver to replace a 10+ year old Pioneer receiver I had for my home theater. Setup was very easy and I appreciated the automated speaker setting using the microphone that's included. Once I got the receiver set up, I was impressed with how much fuller the sound was using the same set of speakers. Tv shows and movies sound clearer and more ambient sounds can be heard from street scenes or sci-fi movies. I paired our iPad to the receiver with no problem and I was impressed with the range of the bluetooth before I started getting distortion. All in all, I'm very pleased withe the quality and ease of setup.
customer_reviews.author: twprovost

customer_reviews.title: Good receiver, glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: Works excellent for me, everything connected as expected. Setup was easy - I'm not real picky. Sound quality / clarity is better than my older Kenwood VR-605, which was pretty good. Like all the presets for sound, they make a difference and are effective for me. Glad I bought this one. I use an old set of rabbit ears from a tv for the antenna, works well in this area and picks up all stations I expected clearly.
customer_reviews.author: sfrenchfl

customer_reviews.title: Great little receiver!
customer_reviews.text: I was VERY hesitant to get rid of my Sony 3000ES receiver and opt for a newer technology receiver. Although I loved the 3000ES, I have to say that I am quite impressed with this new one. It doesn't have all of the bells and whistles that the previous one had (several of which I never used), but on the other hand, had many positive features the other one did not have (blue tooth; wi-fi; HDMI hook ups; etc.). Great receiver at a great price. Love Sony products!!
customer_reviews.author: Arkangel2002

customer_reviews.title: Jammin
customer_reviews.text: I am using this receiver to power two polk audio towers in my living room and the sound quality from this unit is fantastic. I have this receiver hooked up to my smart TV, and there are SO many options to play music from the smart features through the receiver, from my phone, or the TV. I can also stream music directly from my windows computer, which I thought was neat. The APP to control the receiver works very well and definitely makes it easy to pick a source for audio. Overall I'm really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Maurice

customer_reviews.title: Good product, sounds great
customer_reviews.text: Good product, sounds great, many good features for the money, easy installation, however you need a tv or monitor connected to setup and use menus. Recommend using wired Ethernet, wifi skips when the signal is weak. My unit is about 100 feet from my base and media over wifi skipped. Had to run a cable and works great. I like this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Music

customer_reviews.title: Stopped
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed it for two years and it just stopped for no reason...I presume I just toss it and buy another... Sony will probably not fix it and if they do It wouldn't be worth it....not sure if I want to try another Sony.
customer_reviews.author: hannan lyda

customer_reviews.title: Love It.
customer_reviews.text: This item is all that I expected and I am pleased with the quality and power. I couldn't ask for better. The only thing I can't easily figure out is how to preset the FM stations, and I cannot configure the equalizer with just front A speakers. However, I look forward to expanding my speakers and being able to utilize it's full functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Negan 88

customer_reviews.title: Its great when it works.
customer_reviews.text: If this receiver didn't fail on me already, I probably would have given it 5 stars. Set up was easy and sound WAS great for my ears. Has a ton of features that I probably wouldn't use but its nice to have them. Unfortunately after owning this receiver for less that two months the HDMI-out output has mysteriously quit working. My speakers aren't even broken in yet! If it works, its great but mine doesn't so two stars. Update 13 June 2015 Sony support contacted me and sent me instructions on how to fix my problem. 2 minutes later my unit is working again! Thanks for the great customer service Sony! So yeah I gove it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: HDMI connection issues?
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a week. I have determined that the video (HDMI) is starting to fail I believe. Every 5-10 minutes the screen goes black and no picture is displayed, then it returns. I have brand new HDMI cables, and even replaced them to isolate the problem. Has anyone else had this happen? It is very strange since its' so intermittent. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Monty M

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought this, replacing my stereo receiver from ca 1990. TV/streaming audio much improved, network radio and iTunes accessible and sounding terrific. I have no particular expertise with audio equipment, but was able to set everything up without any glitches, with a couple of cables and a little advice from Radioshack. I had been thinking of buying bluetooth speakers but upgrading to a real av receiver has given me a much better quality and more versatile system.
customer_reviews.author: missyhills

customer_reviews.title: This unit is driving high-end Axiom speakers and the sound is amazing. Very clear
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I really was living in the dark ages with my old system. I'm not an audiophile by any means but I know enough to realize quality. This unit is driving high-end Axiom speakers and the sound is amazing. Very clear, no distortion. The Wifi and Bluetooth functionality is incredible. I can control all functions on the unit from across my house.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT NOW if you can still find one, they are no longer being manufactured...
customer_reviews.text: You can turn this one up to a 6... simply the best ever made for the money. Audiophile and Stereophile magazines have rained down praises for years. Once calling it the product of the year. AP and SP evaluate equipment costing over $50,000. If you can still find this Sony unit, buy two and put one away or give as a gift, that's what I did. Functionality and sound quality is worthy of units costing thousands of $$ more. Even a used one from an Amazon supplier could be a smart buy.
customer_reviews.author: BPete

customer_reviews.title: Great AV Receiver but did have to reboot to recover HDMI Video Out (simple process).
customer_reviews.text: Excellent receiver with plenty of great features. The HDMI Video Out died after 20 months with no video on my TV. Called customer service expecting I'd have to return the unit for service (it was still under the 2 year warranty). Instead they took me through a reboot of the receiver, which surprisingly was not in the owners manual. Very happy to report that 2 minute process solved the problem!
customer_reviews.author: Roy S.

customer_reviews.title: Faulty out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The refurbished unit arrived with a defect. With any fluctuation of the line voltage, even as low as half a volt as the result of the a/c, fridge, oven, even the bathroom fan being turned on, the video will flash to black, then the video will be paused. This is a HUGE issue. Sony has declined to offer warranty service due to the unit being refurbished. I will never again buy refurbished.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: ... previously owned an older Sony DVR and it worked fine for many years
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned an older Sony DVR and it worked fine for many years. So I ordered a repacement Sony DVR and I am equally satisfied. I noticed they have scaled down the number of buttons on newer models making it much more user friendly . . while at the same time bumping the Watts/output. My 5 JBL surround sound speakers and my Yamaha subwoofer never sounded better.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Catch up heat very soon and goes to protection mode
customer_reviews.text: It is worst ever electronic item I have ever purchased. Though it is easy to wire with your speakers, its not worth even $10. The item has protection mode which turn off the receiver if picks up heat.I have placed the receiver in ample ventilated area though for the first few days I saw it went to protection mode after 40-50 mins of music play but now (after 30 days) it cuts off music even after 5 minutes of play and the receiver shows no sign being caught up heat. Stay away from this product
customer_reviews.author: GenuineBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at a great/bargain from Amazon Warehouse deals. Product arrived before the expected delivery time in original packaging. All the accessories were present. The original description stated that there was less than 5% damage on top of the receiver, but to my surprise it looked band new without showing any signs of ware and tear. It worked right out of the box....virtually plug and play. Great sound quality and connecting to WiFi and Bluetooth was no big deal at all. It is a great but at this price. Would certainly recommend this product given the deal offered by Amazon Warehouse!
customer_reviews.author: Rupinder Singh

customer_reviews.title: After working fine for 3 months the problem started
customer_reviews.text: I had nothing but problems with this receiver since I bought it. After working fine for 3 months the problem started. It is a hit or a miss that on a day it will work. Keeps us guessing. I have done clearing the system many a times to see if it works. As of today there is no signal coming out of the receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: HDMI failed after 14 months
customer_reviews.text: Receiver worked really well for about 14 months. Then the HDMI output failed, just as described in many other reviews. Had a Sony receiver for 10 years prior to this and never had an issue. Very disappointed in the poor quality on this model. I've had a Yamaha receiver in my basement for 4 years with no HDMI issues, so I'll go Yamaha over Sony from now on.
customer_reviews.author: bravesFan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but complicated
customer_reviews.text: Love this receiver when you finally can understand how it works. Typical Sony, incredible engineering but complicated controls. Not for the easily confused. We have 2 of these and really enjoy the sound quality and the multiple platforms that are powered.
customer_reviews.author: Smokey

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase! Great receiver at great price!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Wasn't sure if I needed the wifi connection and after a few days I'm not sure how I got along without it. I love the song pal app that allows you to listen to stations all over the world with tunein service and dezzer let's you stream music like other apps but without an annoying account. As far as the sound it is quite impressive and if it's connected to a TV then it allows lots of intuitive controls through the on screen UI. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lurker

customer_reviews.title: I bought another one last fall and I have loved using it so much that I have been waiting ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought another one last fall and I have loved using it so much that I have been waiting for the price to come back down so I could replace my not so old Onkyo that has some awful switching problems but does work once you get it working. So far this is working great just like the 1st one and I love these receivers.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the features and the sound that comes from this receiver. It was a total steal at Amazon's price and I would very highly recommended it. I listen to all types of music at very high volume levels on my JBL surround sound system and it has never tripped any circuits so it handles the power just fine. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Kicks so much ass!
customer_reviews.text: Totally bad ass. The networking capabilities alone make this worth it. The bluetooth wakeup feature rocks, and makes it easy to listen to tunes from my phone wherever I am. The price is right, and the tunes are bumpin.
customer_reviews.author: metacyde

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It is a solid performer. I am rating as 5 stars for the performance in this range. I bought it for the BT and wireless capabilities to power my living room and outside speakers. It does great. Wish the volume on BT was same as network and CD audio. I have etc have BT volume 50% higher even with BT audio on phone at max. Can't comment on surround as I didn't buy it for that. Doesn't match my Denon and Klipsch in the theater but I also didn't buy a $1500 receiver. For the sound quality and money it is hard to beat. Can't imagine the surround would disappoint either.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Throughly thought out home theater receiver. I especially like the fact, Airplay can work and connect when the unit is in standby mode. Video quality is great, (only 1080P so far), Sound quality is good to excellent. Straight forward menu system with attractive overlay when in the menu system. I also enjoy the feature that it remembers what sound effect setting is set for each input or mode. So when on HDMI 1 it stays in Pro Logic mode, and when I go to listen to music it stays at Multi-stereo mode. Plenty of inputs, and plenty of features!
customer_reviews.author: HEEEYOO

customer_reviews.title: Works great and have only had to unplug to reset twice ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great and have only had to unplug to reset twice after a power outage. First one was doa but replaced fast. Only main issue I have it it not accepting resolutions outside the hd 4k scope. Issues when plugged into a 1920x1200 monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: This product was amazing. A week earlier
customer_reviews.text: This product was amazing. A week earlier, I decided to return a comparable model from Harmon Kardon. No comparison; the Sony is top quality, doesn't run hot even when driving my HUGE klipsch RF tower speakers at high volumes with demanding hip hop and dance music. The menus are complete, the Bluetooth and AirPlay is reliable and convenient with my iPhone. Plenty connectors and adjustments. Only thing missing is a 10 band EQ instead of a silly bass/treble EQ. In the digital age, an outboard EQ is not an option so it should be inboard!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just an awesome stereo for the price kicks it with my bose ...
customer_reviews.text: Just an awesome stereo for the price kicks it with my bose speakers and 2 powered sub woofers every thing is clear and all volumn levels.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Remote receiver non functional, could not adjust speaker levels.
customer_reviews.text: When received the remote did not work with the unit, this continues to be a problem. All other features of the unit work as expected, and my TV remote can control the volume level, but I have not been able to calibrate the unit. The remote sends IR signals out, and I checked the reception as recommended by the manufacturer but without the remote the sound levels of the speakers cannot be calibrated or adjusted correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Good price with lots of hook-ups
customer_reviews.text: Good price. Lots of HDMI hook ups. Lots of speaker hook ups with plenty of power so the too quiet dialogue can be heard. Additionally, if you own other Sony products, the remote controls have a better than even chance of being interchangeable.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Many features are unreliable and it stopped responding to the remote after a few weeks. Third party remotes don't work either. Sony Support is a joke. I now have a receiver with less features than the cheapest models out there.
customer_reviews.author: Geordie W. Korper

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price, just a bit difficult to operate.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, if you get it on sale. Just a bit difficult to understand how to operate. Turns off automatically which is really nice if you forget! You got to have some patience to understand how to get through all the functions, especially with a remote.
customer_reviews.author: Laoblue

customer_reviews.title: The one that replaced that on still swithed inputs but not so bad and last night the HDMI output stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I returned the first one after two days. It kept switch inputs while watching tv, dvd or playing a game. The one that replaced that on still swithed inputs but not so bad and last night the HDMI output stopped working. I have had this for seven months and now have to buy a new receiver! I will not be a Sony! Nothing but problems since I bought it. I should have bought something else when the first one died.
customer_reviews.author: SHAWN MORNEAU

customer_reviews.title: Clean sound and plenty of features
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a temporary receiver while I got my $1500 Onkyo repaired again. It sounds better than the Onkyo did and has new features as well. I am keeping it in the system! If you have all HDMI components, this is a great receiver. I was amazed to get a Sony for this price.
customer_reviews.author: BobDTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Wifi works well, I paired it with a harmony all-in-one remote and it works well with it. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and sounds just great. Update: 7 months after hooking it up it no longer works. No Video through the HDMI. Tried a different HDMI cable and HDMI ports, same thing. Could get video through a Component cable but of course it was not HD but then that even stopped working. It was great while it worked. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RcC

customer_reviews.title: This is great with a few caveats
customer_reviews.text: This is great with a few caveats. You can't listen to one input while watching TV through another. The Spotify connectivity is basically just you running Spotify through your phone or tablet and playing through Bluetooth. Looks and sounds great otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Byron C Smith

customer_reviews.title: Quality Easy to Use Unit
customer_reviews.text: Very nice machine, I wish it came with speakers that had been made specifically for the unit but my Klipsch speakers sound good on it. My wife loves that directory on it and easily switches it from component to component with ease. This in itself is a definitely a valuable plus for me.
customer_reviews.author: Donald L.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Lots of connections, everything goes through the receiver which in turn reduces the amount of remotes you need to use. It's great. I just need better speakers. Lots of HDMI ports and really easy to set up bluetooth... use it all the time to rock out. I'd totally buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: FrankieR

customer_reviews.title: I liked it, shame it kept turning off after a ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked it, shame it kept turning off after a day, and finally got, in one week, were it was turning off every few minutes. Did have nice sound, easy set up, and a good user interface. But... broken is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: I LIKE THIS RECEIVER
customer_reviews.text: I LIKE THIS RECEIVER ,ITS VERY EASY TO CONNECT TO AUDIO/VIDEO EQUIPMENTS, IT PROVIDES A GREAT SOUND AND IMAGE. ALSO ITS SIZE AND WEIGHT MAKES IT EASY TO PLACE IN A SOUND RACK.I ENJOY IT VERY MUCH.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo Carbo

customer_reviews.title: Worked for awhile, HDMI out now no longer working.
customer_reviews.text: Was working for a good 5 months just fine... then HDMI video out stopped working. Audio is still functioning (for now). Looking at past reviews and have seen this be a problem—now I am experiencing it just the same. Not sure I'd buy this again. Will be reaching out to customer support and hoping not to deal with a nightmare of annoyance in that respect.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J Fulfer

customer_reviews.title: not happy! Poor quality sound and stops working!
customer_reviews.text: This is awful. Got it for my fiancé for Christmas. the remote only works if you are within a couple feet of the device. The Bluetooth doesn't keep a steady connection cuts in a out- poor quality! But within the last couple weeks when watching tv the receiver will just stop working. And I guess now I can't return it and there is no option for repair. Well we pulled it out and now are using are old one... Hoping they will repair it for no charge for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This receiver is great! Sounds good
customer_reviews.text: This receiver is great! Sounds good. Streaming from itunes or Pandora works well (better than my more expensive,but older, Marantz 7005). Only thing I wish it also had was HD radio. The iphone app is good, but could be better (volume control and mute should be always accessible). It was a little unintuitive to set up A-B speakers, but i finally did it. Overall, this receiver has the best combination of features to price around.
customer_reviews.author: Mike A

customer_reviews.title: Simple and practical
customer_reviews.text: Nice and simple. Predicts inputs to amplify so there's little switching and tweaking to find out the right combination of TV, HDMI (1,2,3....) and sound. Natural, decent sound for most non-audiophile applications. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MDMW

customer_reviews.title: Not near the features as the Pioneer it replaced but ...
customer_reviews.text: Not near the features as the Pioneer it replaced but after having a high dollar onkyo and pioneer fail just out of warranty both with the same problem no audio. Thiss was cheap enough that of it does the same it won't hurt so much to toss it.
customer_reviews.author: taciturn

customer_reviews.title: I love the receiver
customer_reviews.text: The only negative I have is the lack of a proper owners MANUAL. The going green statement (to save printing costs) is a hollow statement. I love the receiver.
customer_reviews.author: DAVISRL

customer_reviews.title: Product is defective
customer_reviews.text: This is a defective product as seen by many buyers of this model. BUYER BEWARE they are trying to refuse a refund. Another rip off from SONY
customer_reviews.author: Slyfry

customer_reviews.title: 4 Years later- just an exercise machine
customer_reviews.text: 4 Years Later: No longer communicating with remote. Even tried a new factory remote with no success. If you like to get moving and physically turn volume up and down for every commercial this unit is for you. My review from 4 years ago: Finally started using receiver with other items besides tv and it constantly shuts down. 4 days out of my return period and it looks as though I am stuck with an overheating unit that is only good for watching regular tv.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rideout

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this receiver for two years and then it made a popping noise and stopped working. Expensive investment that should have lasted longer than two years.
customer_reviews.author: Jhende

customer_reviews.title: Sony STR-DN850 Home Theater Receiver
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the Sony STR-DN850 Home Theater Receiver on Amazon.com. This receiver is working perfect for my home theater application. The newest technology packed in to the receiver and the price is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Bad HDMI Output
customer_reviews.text: It just made 11 months and this product is suffering the problems described in many of the negative reviews. I no longer have video/audio outputting to my TV indicating the HDMI output is bad. I've tried several HDMI cables and several HDMI inputs on m TV, to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great price! Bluetooth works at great distance perfectly. Easy on screen setup. I have owned Onkyo and Denon high priced units not even close to this user friendly. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J Dickey

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the money. Exactly as advertised. Easy transaction. Great receiver!
customer_reviews.author: John E.

customer_reviews.title: My first home theatre receiver and I've VERY pleased!
customer_reviews.text: My first receiver amplifier. Streams music from my Amazon Prime cloud and the new music channels they support. I can control it with my Android phone app. Connection was fairly simple and the sound is also great with my Bose system. Bluetooth - Wifi - what more can I ask for!
customer_reviews.author: deanna

customer_reviews.title: I have had 3 of these now all of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had 3 of these now all of the have broken within 3 or 4 months, either sound distored or completely dead, I will never buy another Sony receiver again.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Mucklow

customer_reviews.title: works great. sounds great
customer_reviews.text: works great. sounds great. I run my LG TV through it. I also run my Blue Ray DVD player through it. I have seven speakers plus my subwoofer hooked up and this receiver even helps balance my speakers.
customer_reviews.author: mtvista

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in less than 90 days
customer_reviews.text: One day short of 90 days after receiving the product all of the HDMI ports stopped functioning. We have a workaround to use the speakers but we can no longer access any settings. Since we originally set the system up as a 5.1 it doesn't recognize any additional speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S Garon

customer_reviews.title: ... products over the years and have always been very satisfied. I was happy with this unit until it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had a lot of Sony products over the years and have always been very satisfied. I was happy with this unit until it quit working for no apparent reason after just 1 year almost to the day. It wasn't even used once a week. I am hoping to get some help from Sony or Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mel P Brannon

customer_reviews.title: Was it really used?
customer_reviews.text: Although the receiver was listed as used, it appeared brand new and all the peripherals were still sealed in their bags. I was extremely pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Zargon

customer_reviews.title: Best receive for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent receiver, I'm quite picky... This system was bought to replace an old unit, boy things have changed and improved!!!! My tv and movie experience has improved and this system has enough power to rattle the Windows
customer_reviews.author: Rick G

product_meta.title: Sony STR-DN850 7.2 Channel 4K AV Receiver (Built-in Wi-fi & Bluetooth)
product_meta.description:
Stream crisp, powerful audio with built-in Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and Airplay. With 7.2 channels and 150 watts of power, it's legendary Sony sound that really connects. Featuring 4k resolution pass-through, high-res audio compatibility, 6 HD inputs and a new intuitive graphical interface, this receiver brings out the best in your music, Blu-ray movies, games and more.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



7.2 CH 4K WI-FI NETWORK A/V RECEIVER
Stream crisp, powerful audio with built-in Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and Airplay. With 7.2 channels and 150 watts of power, it’s legendary Sony sound that really connects. Featuring 4k resolution pass-through, high-res audio compatibility, 6 HD inputs and a new intuitive graphical interface, this receiver brings out the best in your music, Blu-ray movies, games and more.

TECHNOLOGY
THE HEART OF YOUR SYSTEM.
Stream crisp, powerful audio with built-in Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and Airplay. With 7.2 channels and 150 watts of power, it’s legendary Sony sound that really connects. Featuring 4K resolution pass-through, high-res audio compatibility, 6 HD inputs and a new intuitive graphical interface, this receiver brings out the best in your music, Blu-ray movies, games and more.

BUILT FOR SOUND.
Borrowing construction and circuitry design cues from our ES line, it all begins with a rigid chassis based on the legendary frame and beam concept. To this structure, we then mount the various components: a high capacity power transformer, custom heat sink, and other specially selected audio-grade components that together add up to class-leading sound quality. For purists, Pure Direct mode preserves signal clarity and detail by switching off unnecessary signal processing circuitry to provide the cleanest possible signal path with minimized electronic interference.

SWEET SOUND.
Not only powerful, to deliver impressive multi-channel sound performance. (145W x 7 @ 6 ohms, 1 kHz, 0.9% THD), the STR-DN850 features the best audio technology from both Sony Music and Sony Pictures and can even support Hi-Resolution audio playback (bit rates up to 192k/24-bit WAV/FLAC). Added amplifier functionality allows for configuration flexibility including: speakers A or B, speakers A and B, in addition to Bi-Amp should the scenario call for it.

WI-FI BUILT-IN1
Wirelessly connect to your home network and via the integrated DLNA support access music stored on: your computer, network storage device, or even your smartphone. Via built-in music service support13, you can access and enjoy music streaming at its very best-the latest from Pandora, Spotify, Music Unlimited, and tunein. Also AirPlay compatible, you can easily stream your music and music apps from your iPhone/iPod/ iPad or iTunes.

CONNECT IT ALL WITH BLUETOOTH1
The STR-DN850 receiver effortlessly streams music from your smartphone or tablet so nothing is out of reach. Now anyone can be the DJ-no wires, no problem. Bluetooth streaming can even wake the receiver from standby mode to get the party started. Built-in AAC and aptX codec support avoids signal quality loss when streaming music wirelessly.

WELL CONNECTED.
Enjoy versatile HD connectivity with five HDMI inputs (up to 4K capable) and connect a Sony PlayStation entertainment system, Blu-ray Disc player, or any other HDMI-capable devices2. Via an MHL (Mobile High-Definition Link) certified HDMI cable, you can even plug-in your smartphone and share favorite personal video clips, music, and more on the big screen complete with big sound3. The front-mounted USB input even allows for easy connectivity and charging with compatible devices1.

ADDITIONAL FEATURES
ADVANCED ON-SCREEN DISPLAY.
Class-leading performance demands a powerful user experience. Via an advanced on-screen user interface, the STR-DN850 affords comprehensive system control, settings adjustment, input selection, and the like with seamless visual confirmation on your TV screen.

HD DIGITAL CINEMA SOUND.
Optimize receiver settings to mimic movie theater sound characteristics. Front Height mode enables vocal height and 3D effects for improved effects positioning and added depth. Imagine as a helicopter descends from above and lands right in front of you – you’ll hear the change in height as the effect unfolds on-screen.

EASY SETUP, OPTIMIZED USE...
Proper system setup and optimization shouldn’t be an ordeal. Easy Setup using the simplified remote in comjunction with an intuitive, on-screen interface, leverages the power of Digital Cinema Auto Calibration (D.C.A.C.) and a supplied microphone to optimize settings based upon room charachteristics and speaker distance and placement.

HANDY REMOTE CONTROL.
Easily and intuitively control the receiver via SongPal and your Bluetooth-enabled smartphone. Simply download the free SongPal app from iTunes or Google Play Store, install it on your smart device and take control of your receiver and your favorite movie and music content, including receiver settings, media metadata, and more – all through one app.

1Wireless connectivity requires an 802.11 home network (802.11n recommended).2Broadband speed of at least 2.5 Mbps recommended (10 Mbps for HD). Content subject to change and may require fees.3Interoperability and compatibility among Bluetooth devices vary.4Requires HDMI cable sold separately.5Cable sold separately.64k upscaling requires a 4K projector or 4K TV.7Requires capable HDTV, capable video source, and HDMI cable sold sep. When playing copyright protected content from Sony 4K server, it is necessary to use a separate HDMI audio out from server to receiver for surround sound support.8Application must be downloaded from the iTunes application store or Google Play store. Requires devices connected to the same wireless home network. Subject to app terms and conditions.9Requires HDTV and HDMI cable sold separately.10Not all USB devices are compatible. Consult www.esupport.sony.com for complete details.11Requires 3D content, 3D HDTV, 3D glasses and HDMI cable (at least 10.2 Gbps).12Requires HDMI cable sold separately.13Requires HDMI cable and LPCM capable receiver.14Syncs with BRAVIA Sync or Theatre Sync products.15Requires content stored on a DLNA compliant PC or server.
 2014 Sony Electronics Inc. All rights reserved. Reproduction in whole or in part without written permission is prohibited.

Sony, BRAVIA, Theatre Sync, 24p True Cinema and Digital Cinema Sound are trademarks of Sony Corporation. PlayStation is a trademark of Sony Computer Entertainment. Blu-ray Disc and Blu-ray 3D are trademarks of Blu-ray Disc Association. Dolby is a registered trademark of Dolby Laboratories. dts is a trademark of dts Inc. HDMI is a trademark of HDMI Licensing LLC. iPod, iPhone, iPod touch, iPod classic, iPod nano, iTunes, AirPlay are registered trademarks of Apple Inc., registered in the U.S. and other countries.. Bluetooth is a trademark of Bluetooth SIG, Inc. Wi-Fi is a registered trademark of the Wi-Fi Alliance. All other trademarks are trademarks of their respective owners. Features and specifications are subject to change without notice.
feature_bullets: 7.2 Channel 1050W A/V Receiver (150W x 7 at 6 ohms, 1 kHz, THD 0.9%)
Optimized components and circuitry for fine-tuned audio response
Built-in Wi-Fi with DLNA and Airplay capability

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars391 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
